Andy Dee
Jeff Nelson
Joe Lindzius
Chad "C.J." Udeen }} '''Molly & the Heymakers''' was an American [[country music]] group formed in 1987. The band consisted of Martha "Molly" Scheer ([[lead vocals]], [[fiddle]], [[mandolin]], [[rhythm guitar]]), Andy Dee ([[lead guitar]]), Jeff Nelson ([[bass guitar]]), Joe Lindzius ([[drum kit|drums]]) and Chad "C.J." Udeen ([[steel guitar]]). Their highest charting single, "Chasin' Something Called Love," peaked at No. 50 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles & Tracks]] chart in 1991; it was included on their self-titled debut album, issued in 1992 on [[Reprise Records]]. ==Transition to new sound== In 1998, Molly Scheer and Andy Dee, along with Rick Berger ([[bass guitar]]) and Scott Tate ([[drum kit|drums]]), released an album of harder-edged material under the moniker known as "Molly & The Makers." The music on this album featured a mixture of styles including [[Alt.country]], [[Cowpunk]], [[Country music|Country]], [[folk rock]], [[Rockabilly|Rock and Roll]], [[Alternative rock]], [[Rock music|rock]], [[power pop]], [[punk rock]], [[Garage punk (fusion genre)|garage punk]], [[indie rock]] and [[indie pop]]. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" ! style="width:16em;"| Title ! style="width:18em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''Molly & The Heymakers'' | * Release date: 1988 * Label: Muskie Queen Records |- ! scope="row"| ''Live Wires'' | * Release date: 1989 * Label: Muskie Queen Records |- ! scope="row"| ''Molly & the Heymakers'' | * Release date: March 31, 1992 * Label: [[Reprise Records]] |- ! scope="row"| ''B-Sides from the Milkhouse'' | * Release date: 1993 * Label: Muskie Queen Records |- ! scope="row"| ''Big Things'' | * Release date: 1995 * Label: Muskie Queen Records |- ! scope="row"| ''Lucky Flame''
